qas.question: Under what condition can ferrous hydroxide be oxidized?

context:
In its turn, under <a0_0>anaerobic<a0_0/> conditions, the ferrous hydroxide (Fe(OH)
2 ) can be oxidized by the protons of water to form <a1_0>magnetite and molecular hydrogen<a1_0/>. This process is described by the <a2_0>Schikorr reaction<a2_0/>:
